Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    La classe Game est l'axe centrale de la programme. Il contient la seule méthode main() et donc est la seule classe éxécutable, et en plus contient dedans les sous-méthodes qui aident l'éxécution du jeu directement (par ex., initialise(), takeGuesses(), etc.).
    Since:
    26-04-2019
    Author:
    Luke Byrne, Lilian Morgan, Heather Lloyd

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        The class Game contains the only main function, as stated above. This is the core of the games running. It puts all the other functions found in the project to use in order to create the basic logic game in the project.
        Parameters:
        args - = input from terminal
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for file input
        Since:
        26-04-2019

      • takeTurn

        public static boolean takeTurn(Player p,
                               Board b,
                               VectorList v)
        takeTurn() allows the user to take their turn! It takes in the current player, the board, and the list of words and then gives the player three chances to make the random word appear in their list -- if it does, then you win that turn! If not, you have to try again for nbTry amount of times.
        Parameters:
        p - = the current player
        b - = the board
        v - = the list of words and their associated vectors
        Returns:
        boolean saying you won the turn or not
        Since:
        26-04-2019

      • takeGuesses

        private static Vector[] takeGuesses(Vector randomWord,
                                    VectorList v)
        takeGuesses() does just that - it takes the task of taking in the user's three guesses as to what the "random word" in the game might be. This randomWord is taken in as input to make sure that the user hasn't used that as one of their guesses - that, of course, would be cheating. This function also checks to make sure the users' guesses are actual words - this alone saves an enormous amount of error handling. It returns, in a Vector array, the three guesses.
        Parameters:
        randomWord - = for use in comparison and to prevent cheating
        v - = used to see if word exists
        Returns:
        indices = the three guesses taken in from this function
        Since:
        26-04-2019
